data.question: What is the chemical formula of the novel metalloligand presented in the research?
What type of geometry does the iron center adopt in the metalloligand [FeIII(L)2]ClO4·2 MeCN?
What is the magnetic moment of 1·2 MeCN in the temperature range 5–300 K?
What solvent facilitates the reduction of 1 in MeCN solution?
What is the topology of the 3D coordination polymer 2·x S?
What is the Fe-Nendo bond length in the iron(ii) metalloligand within the 3D coordination polymer 2·x S?
What happens to the framework of 2·x S when removed from the mother liquor?
data.answer: The framework collapses due to easy escape of solvent molecules.

data.question: Why is the metalloligand 1 considered useful for assembling [FeII(L)2] moieties?
data.answer: Because of its ease of reduction and good solubility in MeCN and CH3NO2.

data.question: What indicates that the iron(iii) metalloligand is reduced to [FeII(L)2] in the 3D coordination polymer 2·x S?
data.answer: The Fe-Nendo distance of 2.007(3) Å, which is somewhat longer than that of 1.

data.question: What is the result of the variable-temperature magnetic susceptibility measurements on 2?
What does the cMT value of 1.72 cm3 K mol-1 at the highest temperature (380 K) for 2 indicate?
data.answer: The highest molar fraction of a high-spin state gHS is estimated to be 0.57.

data.question: Is the 3D framework of 2 stable outside the mother liquor?
Does the metalloligand [FeIII(L)2]ClO4·2 MeCN have a trigonal-antiprismatic geometry?
Is the magnetic moment of 1·2 MeCN higher than 2 mB?
Does the addition of hydroquinone prevent the reduction of 1 in MeCN solution?
Is the topology of 2 related to a body-centered cubic structure?
Does the 3D coordination polymer 2·x S show a complete spin transition?
Is the Fe-Nendo bond length in 2 at 150 K comparable to that of high-spin iron(ii) complexes?
What is the role of Rh2(OAc)4 in the synthesis of 2·x S?
data.answer: It acts as a linear spacer in the assembly of the coordination polymer.

data.question: What does the presence of a single 1s!3d pre-edge absorption peak in the XANES spectra of 2 indicate?
data.answer: It indicates a transition feature corresponding to a low-spin iron(ii) complex.
